results.title: Youth and music
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roger Blais and Claude Jutra
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.

results.title: Youth and credit (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Geoff Scott presents a dramatised story of a young man who encounters a series of escalating problems with credit, relating to the purchase of a car. The film is then discussed with an invited audience of teenagers and ‘experts’ with the aim of introducing safe ways of handling credit. The video is accompanied by Teacher’s notes. Pt. 1. The forum. Pt. 2. Eddy: a trigger film.

results.title: Yours truly, Andrea G. Stern
results.brief_description: A ten year old struggles with the problem of sharing her mother with a boyfriend who has just moved into the house. The mother is completely at a loss as to what to do, as what seemed a fine idea to her at first quickly turns sour with resentment and jealousy. The resolution of this conflict is thoroughly realistic, and without a “happily ever after” ending.

results.title: Your very good health
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas and Joy Batchelor
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Charley”.
A cartoon illustrating various aspects of Britain’s National Health Service Scheme. Discusses in particular the effect of the scheme on the average British family.

results.title: Your turn in the box
results.creator_credit: Lord and King Associates and Bob O'Donnell
results.brief_description: Hank Aaron, who is considered by many people to be the greatest right-handed hitter of modern times, instructs a young baseball player in the fundamentals and philosophy of batting. The frequent use of slow-motion and close-up photography graphically communicates the proper techniques and methods that any ballplayer must know and do in order to become a valuable member of his team.

results.title: Your town : communications
results.brief_description: Communication systems help to bind a community through shared information, ideas and entertainment, and systems covered in this video include television, newspapers, computers and the telephone. Go behind the scenes at a TV station to see how a local news team develops a story for telecast. See how a newspaper prepares a story, text and pictures for print. Learn the importance of computers, telephones and satellites in increasing the ease and speed of communication. For a community to function efficiently and safely, all of its citizens must have access to a means of communicating in an emergency, an example of which is the use of a TTY phone for hearing impaired people. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
